availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. Beaucamp (Fleming County, Kentucky, cabinet maker and mechanic)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, cabinet maker and mechanic. Maryland native. Married to Nancy J. Beaucamp. Father of Mary W. Beaucamp, Thomas M. Beaucamp, Amelia M. Beaucamp, Annie Beauchamp, and William Beauchamp. Cabinet-maker in Fleming County in 1850 and 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1850.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Poplar Plains, p. 666. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 24. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 4, p. 8. Find A Grave, "William S Beauchamp (1828-1879)," Memorial #128287614, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=128287614&ref=acom (accessed June 16, 2017). KYR-0001-029-0573.
